citeinfo.origin: Satellite Pour l'Ovservation de la Terre (SPOT)
citeinfo.title: Spot High Resolution Visible Data

descript.abstract: Data Type: Remotely Sensed Data; The French Earth Observation Satellite, SPOT, produces digital satellite imagery with the highest spatial resolution that is commercially available. Panchromatic (black and white) imagery has a resolution of 10x10 meters, and is commonly used for detailed mapping, feature identification, change detection, and updating of vector files. Multispectral imagery (visible and infrared) has a resolution of 20x20 meters and is used for land use and land cover mapping and natural resource studies. SPOT Image offers its digital ortho-imagery in standard 7.5, 15, and 30 minute map frames.

idinfo.accconst: Contact SPOT Image Corporation for a SPOT Data Fee Schedule for update on data prices.
idinfo.useconst: Licensee agrees to limits to internal use and copy restrictions.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.
